intro: Cliffortia baccans, commonly known as the red-stemmed sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, often woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, fleshy, red fruits. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Cliffortia baccans is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various animals.
